main_definition: easy to see or understand; obvious, clear.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Easily noticed or understood; visible or obvious.
meanings_and_examples.example: The damage from the storm was apparent in the fallen trees and power lines.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Seeming to be true, real, or certain, especially without proof.
meanings_and_examples.example: It seemed apparent that she would win the race based on her previous performances.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Appearing as though something is true when it may not actually be so; deceptive or misleading.
meanings_and_examples.example: His sudden wealth was an apparent change in his lifestyle, but he never really had much money to begin with.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Appearing by chance; accidental or unintentional.
meanings_and_examples.example: The discovery of the ancient artifact was purely accidental during a routine archaeological dig.
